translation2: All Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools are carefully inspected, tested, and subjected to strict controls by the Bosch quality assurance. Therefore, Bosch provides a guarantee for Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools. The warranty claims of the buyer from the purchase contract with the seller, as well as legal rights, are not restricted by this guarantee. For these tools, we provide warranty according to the following conditions: We provide warranty according to the provisions of the following regulations (Nos. 2-7) by repairing the defective tool free of charge, which can be proven to have arisen within the warranty period due to a material or manufacturing defect. The warranty period is 24 months for private use, 12 months for commercial or professional use or equivalent wear and tear. The warranty period begins with the purchase by the first buyer. The decisive date is the date on the original purchase receipt. For all tools purchased from September 1, 2004 onwards, which are intended for professional use and are blue (excluding high-frequency tools, industrial battery-powered screwdrivers, and pneumatic tools), the warranty period is extended to 36 months if the buyer registers the tools within 4 weeks of the purchase date. Battery packs and chargers, as well as accessories delivered with the tools, are excluded from this extended warranty. Registration can only be made online at [www.bosch-pt.com/warranty](http://www.bosch-pt.com/warranty). The confirmation of registration is the registration receipt, which must be printed immediately, as well as the original purchase receipt, which shows the date of purchase. Registration is only possible if the buyer agrees to the storage of his data there. Excluded from the warranty are: parts that are subject to normal wear and tear, as well as defects in the tool that are due to normal use, unusual environmental conditions, unusual operating conditions, overloading, or insufficient maintenance or care. Defects in the tool caused by the use of non-Bosch accessory parts, replacement parts, or spare parts. Tools that have undergone modifications or additions. Minor deviations from the specified condition that are insignificant for the value and usability of the tool. The removal of the defect recognized by us as warranty-worthy is carried out in such a way that we repair the defective tool free of charge or replace it with a flawless tool (possibly also a subsequent model) at our discretion. Replaced tools or parts become our property.
reference: All Bosch electronic, compressed air and measuring tools are carefully examined and tested and undergo the strictest review from Bosch quality assurance. Bosch provides thereby warranty for Bosch electronic, compressed air and measuring tools. This warranty does not limit buyer’s warranty claims for defects that come from the contract of purchase with the seller as well as their legal rights. We offer warranty for this tool under the following conditions: We offer a warranty according to the measures of the following provisions (No. 2-7) via free repair of the tool defect, which can demonstrably be traced back to a material or manufacturing error on the part of the manufacturer within the warranty period. The warranty period is 24 months, 12 months for commercial, professional or similar usage. The warranty period begins with the purchase by the first end customer. The authoritative date is on the original receipt of purchase. If the buyer registered the tools within the first 4 weeks after the date of purchase, then all commercial blue electronic tools and measuring tools (excluding high-frequency tools, industrial battery-powered screwdrivers and compressed air tools) purchased since September 1st, 2004 have an extended warranty period of 36 months. Battery packs and charging stations as well as accessories delivered with them are excluded from this extended warranty period. The registration can take place online at www.bosch-pt.com/warranty. The registration receipt serves as a confirmation, which needs to be printed out immediately, just like the original receipt of purchase, which determines the date of purchase. Registration is then only possible if the buyer consents to the saving of the data which they provide there. Not included in the warranty are: Parts subject to wear from use or other natural wear and tear, and defects in the tool due to use or other natural wear and tear, abnormal environmental conditions, extraneous operating conditions, overloading or can be traced back to a lack of maintenance or care. Tools which were damaged during use with accessory, complimentary or replacement parts which are not Bosch’s original parts. Tools, which have undergone changes or supplementations. Minor deviations from the intended product that do not significantly decrease the value or usability of the tool. The repair of faults which are recognized as covered by the warranty occur in this fashion: we repair the faulty tool free of charge though our method or by replacing it with a functioning tool (if necessary by a subsequent model). Replaced tools or parts then become our property.

translation2: Tire Choice for Racing Bikes - Really That Safe? I've been eagerly awaiting today, because I wanted to prepare for my upcoming cycling tour next week by at least a little bit of training. Said and done, and I went out on my racing bike, which I bought yesterday on eBay. The first 40km were great too - but then what happened, what lurks in every city center (this time: Thanks Krefeld!) happened. Glass shards on the route. Zack, loud hissing and my rear tire didn't want to continue the rest of the route on no account. Since I couldn't really get a replacement tire and tube on Wednesday due to the day of the week, I had to turn around with half-hearted mood and take the first train home. It wasn't quite as bad weather-wise, maybe it's better if I practice the tire change before the tour. Now I stand before a question and hope that you can help me. Since I have a relatively long route over several days ahead of me, I would extremely unwillingly have this problem again and again. Now it wasn't really bad, because also the old tires from the previous owner (very nice old man, who had driven 140km on the day I picked up the bike until 14:12!) and he also already described them as suboptimal because he had driven with them for years. But if I think about the fact that I have to change the tire after 80-90km, then I'm afraid I'm really in a bad mood :D Now I've had a conversation with an older man at the platform who asked me why I didn't have Marathon Plus tires; these are supposed to be unbreakable. That sounds very tempting. But are they really that indestructible? I don't want to spend 40€/tire now to find out that I'm disappointed. I continue to wonder: I currently have 25x622 on my bike, which is apparently also available (apparently?) with Marathon Plus tires, but the majority is already wider. Is this a problem? Or would you advise me to other tires with a racing bike in general? The Schwalbe side seems to be my absolute! My knowledge of the topic is rather in favor of the Durano DD. Thank you already in advance for the help and warm greetings!

translation2: "The party we wanted to throw": Frankfurt celebrates after a torrid comeback against Leverkusen What a spectacular reaction from Eintracht Frankfurt. After 22 minutes, the last time they won twice in a row, it seemed that the Hesse were on their way to another Bundesliga failure. But then the SGE turned it around, shot off their frustration over a mediocre season start within an hour and won wildly with 5:2. "It's crazy what the guys have done today," jubiled coach Oliver Glasner to DAZN and gave a "general compliment to everyone who was there," expressing admiration for their performance. It initially looked like another dampener for the Frankfurt team, who are still behind their expectations in ninth place. Patrik Schick had given Leverkusen a 2-0 lead. But what happened next impressed even the SGE coach. "How the players came back and showed a fantastic performance," Glasner continued. I am crazy happy with the performance we showed and of course with the result. Even defender Christopher Lenz, who was able to play again for the first time since the fourth game week and his injured muscle, emphasized the morale of his teammates. "I believe our mentality is incredible," said the 27-year-old and was particularly pleased for the fans with the result. That was the party we wanted to throw. But for the upcoming tasks, Glasner wants to keep the focus on himself, and he feels well prepared in terms of personnel. It is extraordinary that all players are fit in December and in top physical condition. It is top work in our medical department, but the players also live highly professionally. Now you want to "take it step by step and stay humble" and go through the tasks until the end of the year "at this level." The next game is already scheduled for Wednesday, as part of the English week, an away game at Borussia Mönchengladbach (18:30, Sky).

translation2: Federal Minister of Housing Klara Geywitz (SPD): Expropriation does not create any new apartments The new Federal Minister of Housing, Klara Geywitz (SPD), has spoken out against the expropriation of large apartment corporations, as it has been demanded in a referendum in Berlin. "With expropriation, no single new apartment is created, it only changes the ownership structure," said Geywitz in an interview with the "Tagesspiegel" (Sunday). My goal is to give tenants security that their rent will remain affordable in the coming years. A colorful mix of private landlords, cooperatives, or housing associations, for example, is actually the best protection against monopolization. In Berlin, the coalition of SPD, Greens, and Left Party plans to set up an expert commission, as with the results of the referendum. However, if the situation does not calm down, Geywitz has just spoken with the FDP in the traffic light coalition about further tightening of the rental law. The coalition agreement provides for a rent brake until 2029, a limit on rent increases in tense housing markets, and the expansion of the rent index. I will discuss this with the Justice Minister as soon as possible. If the rental market does not calm down, "we will discuss further steps with our coalition partners," emphasized the SPD politician.

In the F1 there was even knowledge gaps of the rules in the commentary by Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, both of them didn’t know that during a red flag the tires are allowed to be changed. Neither ServusTV nor ORF do this. Both of these broadcasters also do less commercials than Sky during training, and they are free TV broadcasters. You even have to congratulate Glock and Baumgartner for their work, but that alone doesn’t cause me to overlook the disadvantages. translation2: I find it generally unfair to expect children to take on the role of parents for their younger siblings. However, I do think it's good for older siblings to take care of their younger siblings to some extent. They can take turns keeping an eye on them, helping out, and even bringing them a drink, for example. This way, they learn responsibility, help out in the family, and feel included. As long as they are still capable of taking care of themselves, I don't see a problem with it. If your K1 is occupied for a short time and it's okay for him, that's fine. You can best assess whether it's suitable for your children. It's not like he has to take care of K2 all the time and stay with him until he falls asleep. Legally, it may be questionable. Perhaps that's why the psychologist's statement comes into play. If something were to happen like a fire, burglary, earthquake, alien invasion, etc., it would be too much responsibility for K1 to take care of K2. Whether you want to take that risk is, of course, up to you :)
reference: I also think that as a general rule, children should not be expected to overtake a parental role for their younger siblings. However, I think it is also good for older siblings to care for the younger ones to some degree. Sometimes check-up on them, sometimes help, sometimes get the bottle, etc. They learn responsibility this way, help within the family and are thus connected with it. As long as they can continue to be a kid themselves, I don’t see the problem. If your first child looks after themselves alone for a short amount of time, that is OK, that is actually good. You can best get a sense of whether or not this works for your children. It is not as if they should change the second child’s diaper and sit for hours by them as they fall asleep. It is probably questionable from a strictly legal perspective. Maybe the psychologist would also have something to say about it. Since if something actually does happen, like a fire, break-in, earthquake, alien invasion, etc., it would be too much responsibility for child 1 to take care of child 2. If that is a risk that you would like to take that is up to you, of course ;)

translation2: Heavy "Huidlerer" question: The Amberg man knows the solution What please is an "Huidlerer"? Christoph Hafer from BC Bad Feilnbach came in eighth place after landing in fourth in the first run. “If I knew what he was doing differently, then I would also do that,” Lochner said. Nolte with win at home - Podium for Jamanka On the women’s side of things, Laura Nolte landed her third victory in the two-person sled on her home track. After only managing fourth place in the single bob the day before, she raced to World Cup victory on Sunday in the German triple with pusher Deborah Levi. Two-person bob Olympic champion Mariama Jamanka from BRC Thüringen came in second place to Germany’s quickest sprinter, Alexandra Burghardt. She managed the first podium spot this winter along with her Olympic qualifications. Kim Kalicki from Wiesbaden landed in third place with Leonie Fiebig. It was super cool for me to stand first place on the podium in the World Cup, I am super happy, that Mariama took me along with. I am overjoyed with the development. There is still a lot of potential when starting, the starting times today were only okay,” said Burghardt and emphasized: “It is not just about the push start, but involves a lot of things related to that”. Jamanka was a little frustrated with the not totally perfect run, but admitted: “It’s a step in the right direction”.
